programme.title: Lord of the Elves
programme.desc: In an ancient age, the peace-loving Hobbits are enslaved by the Java Men, a race of flesh-eating dragon-riders. The young Hobbit Goben must join forces with their neighbor giants, the humans, to free his people and vanquish their enemies.

programme.title: Sinbad And The War Of The Furies
programme.desc: On a treasure hunt gone wrong, modern-day adventurer Sinbad accidentally releases the Furies, three beautiful but terrible ancient beings powerful enough to threaten life on Earth.

programme.title: Sinister Squad
programme.desc: When a violent supernatural cult known as Death's Messengers reigns terror on Earth, a team of malevolent storybook villains is coerced into fighting in the modern world, but these baddies must learn to keep their true wickedness at bay if they want any chance at freedom.

programme.title: Titanic II
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the original voyage, a modern luxury liner christened "Titanic II," follows the path of its namesake. But when a tsunami hurls an ice berg into the new ship's path, the passengers and crew must fight to avoid a similar fate.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Astronomer George Herbert (C. Thomas Howell) is assigned to investigate reports of strange meteors crashing into earth near New York, Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. As the meteors land, enormous multi-limbed metal creatures disembark and begin destroying everything and everyone in their path with heat-ray guns. Amidst the apocalyptic destruction, Herbert teams with a soldier (Andy Lauer) and a pastor (Rhett Giles) on his journey into Washington to reunite with his family.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body - but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind - tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Design Your Heart Out" - In this episode, the designers are challenged to create a signature dress for the Campbell's "AdDRESS Your Heart" program.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Run for Cover" - The bar is raised when the remaining designers get one of the biggest challenges in Project Runway history that comes with an unprecedented prize at stake. Big personalities begin to upset the temperature in the workroom.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Little Bit of Fashion" - It's anything but child's play as the designers dig into the depths of their creativity for their "mini" challenge. But which designers will be triumphant on the runway, and which will be crying for their mommies?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Hard Wear" - The designers strap on their "tool belts" to show off their "construction" skills. But as they prepare for the Runway, each designer fears they may end up in the bottom.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Elements of Fashion" - The designers have to use the four elements as inspiration for their garments. But which designers will drown with their water-inspired looks or go up in flames with their fire-inspired ones?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Takin' it to the Street" - The designers look to four NYC neighborhoods for inspiration in their next Team Challenge. One designer's partner choice leads to a contentious team paring.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Hey, That's My Fabric" - The designers are asked to create their own fabric as the basis for their looks.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Sew Much Pressure" - One designer's surprise announcement leads to another designer's second chance. Reeling from the shocking news, the designers have to compose themselves as they design a red carpet garment for a tough, opinionated celebrity.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Big, Top Designers" - The designers visit the circus for their latest inspiration. But whose garments will be show-stopping, and whose will look clownish? Designer Cynthia Rowley guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 1" - Tim makes hometown visits and gives his critiques to the four finalists. Mila and Jay must show the judges three of the garments from their collections to determine who will show at Fashion Week.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''Message in a Bottle'' - Hobie overhears his divorcing parents arguing and boats away to a deserted island with two friends, only to have their boat drift away, leaving them stranded on the island with modern day pirates!

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''The Drowning Pool'' - A wealthy older man drowns under suspicious circumstances in front of Jill Riley's tower. Jill endures the pain of losing her first victim, becoming obsessed with unravelling whether his death was an accidental drowning, or murder.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Best Friends 2 Show" - Over the course of three days, six contestants compete against each other in three stunts designed to test them both physically and mentally.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Game Show
programme.desc: "Episode 102" - Comedy duo The Rubber Bandits provide anarchic commentary and their own twisted, surreal take on the action as the increasingly bedraggled contestants make their way through the show.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: "Episode 2" - Bear Grylls abandons 13 ordinary British men on a remote, uninhabited island in the Pacific, where they are utterly alone, filming themselves. Can they survive for a month when stripped of all the luxuries and conveniences of 21st-century living? Does modern British man still have the spirit and skills to survive? In this episode, 48 hours since their last meal and hunger grips the group as the harsh reality of island life is dawning. The race is on to bring food back to camp before they become too weak to hunt. The men take greater and greater risks in the pursuit of vital calories, desperate to seek new ways to chase, trap and outsmart the island's elusive wildlife. Ryan lashes out in anger and Craig is left deflated. And then they come face to face with one of the island's most fearsome predators - the caiman crocodile.

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: In the brutal World War II Battle of Saipan, Sergeant Joe Enders (Nicolas Cage) guards -- and befriends -- Ben Yahzee (Adam Beach), a young Navajo trained in the one wartime code never broken by the enemy...the Navajo Code. But if Yahzee should fall into enemy hands, how far will Enders go to save the military's most powerful secret? John Woo directs this action-packed epic inspired by the true story of the Navajo soldiers whose courage and sacrifices helped win the war in the Pacific.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''The Fabulous Buchannon Boys'' - Mitch receives an unexpected visit from his free-spirited brother, whose troubled son entices Hobie to surf the pylons of a treacherous condemned pier. Meanwhile, a local vendor nearly causes a riot when his bikinis disintegrate in the water.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: Drive
programme.desc: Joey is going away for the weekend with his latest girlfriend, and Craig is surprised when Joey tells him he can stay on his own – and even have the guys over! When the guys get to Craig’s for the weekend, they can’t think of much to do – they’re bored. After a lame afternoon they’re raring to let loose - and what better way than by taking a drive?

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: Shout, Pt. 1
programme.desc: The Degrassi Panthers have a new star soccer player, Spinner. His victory’s even sweeter when Paige agrees to a movie. When the losing team's defensive back, the gorgeous Dean, invites a smitten Paige to a house party, she cancels on Spinner.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: Shout, Pt. 2
programme.desc: Haunted by memories of her recent sexual assault, Paige is desperately trying to appear normal. A girl band contest sounds like a great distraction. Terri wants to reunite PMS—including Ashley. Paige refuses, and recruits Hazel instead.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: Mirror in the Bathroom
programme.desc: Toby is tired of being an invisible computer geek so he decides to join a sports team. Girls love wrestlers - that includes Toby’s crush Kendra. To Toby's dismay, the few extra pounds he carries put him in the same weight class as athletic Sean.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: Take My Breath Away

programme.desc: Grade Nine International Day is coming up and Hazel isn’t thrilled. After all, Hazel’s Jamaican and everybody loves the islands - right? When the day arrives, Hazel’s display is a hit, but she isn’t acting like herself.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation: White Wedding, Pt. 1
programme.desc: Emma Nelson is reveling in her newest job as her mom's maid of honour and planner extraordinaire! Her mom, Spike, is marrying her high-school crush, Snake - who also just happens to be Emma's favourite teacher.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Charlie'' - When Mojo the lab gets a case of the "terrible twos", his family turns to adoption to find him a new playmate. Brandon thinks Charlie, an energetic black lab mix, could fit the bill, but only if Charlie can overcome her control issues and lack of focus.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Jingles'' - Jingles the pointer mix must learn to shed his anxiety and master skills needed to become an off-leash pet for the outdoor-loving Valle family. But will the Valle's own daughter, Isabella, be able to overcome her anxiety of dogs in time for the adoption?

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''A Family Affair!'' - Brandon doesn't just consider the dog when creating a training plan, he also factors in the dynamic and needs of the forever family. In this episode Brandon revisits some of his most important and heart-warming "family inspired" training moments.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Barnaby '' - Brandon rescues Barnaby, a tiny terrier with big-top potential. Barnaby is on track to graduate agility training with honors, but can first time dog owner, Howard, pass Dog Training 101?

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Bailey'' - The Weiss family gets their golden opportunity when Brandon rescues Bailey, a five-month-old pure bred Golden Retriever. But will this chowhound's nose for trouble be too much for the Weiss family's traditional house rules?

programme.desc: ''Evan'' - On the verge of a new chapter in their lives, the Sarac family hopes to adopt Evan, a four-year-old black Labrador mix. But will this big dog with the big personality be more than this family of four can handle?

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Sadie'' - Brandon faces one of his biggest challenges yet. He must find the perfect shelter dog to assist a woman with very special needs. And he'll have to devise a new form of training in order to make the match successful.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Chance'' - From red collar to white collar! Marketing Executive Christina wants to adopt a puppy she can take to her office. But if Chance, the Pointer Mix, wants to join the work force, he'll need to learn "get to work" on potty training.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Cora'' - Cora, an eight-year-old Doberman mix, gets a new shot at life when potential owner, Nikki, decides to adopt a senior dog. But will Cora be able to shed a lifetime of bad habits to make way for a new talent?

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Shadow'' - Living alone for the first time in fifty years, retiree Gary seeks out a new companion in Shadow, a one-year old Chihuahua mix. But before they can make new memories together, Shadow must learn to put aside the trust issues of his past.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Pluto'' - We're blasting off! Brandon rescues Pluto, a Tibetan terrier mix with gravity defying energy. But will Pluto's marking habit ground the adoption process before it can launch?

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

Uncovering the origins of the universe is considered humankind’s greatest intellectual task. By recreating key experiments, Jim unravels the cosmic mystery of science’s creation story, the Big Bang.

programme.title: The End

programme.title: Cloud Cities of Venus
programme.desc: The surface air of Venus is 95% carbon dioxide, and has an atmospheric pressure equivalent to being 900 meters deep in the ocean. These conditions are of course, unlivable for humans. programme.title: Rowdy Rebel Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Rowdy Rebel joins Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his favorite Air Jordans, wearing Off-White x Air Jordan 1s when he went home, and wanting to go shopping with Bobby Shmurda in the future.

programme.title: G Herbo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: G Herbo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about how he used to clean sneakers growing up, camping out for shoes, and why he loves Air Force 1s so much.

programme.title: How to Cook a Double-Dipped Roast Beef Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: The double-dipped roast beef burger is an icon of Brooklyn, New York, and Burger Scholar George Motz is here to teach you how to make one at home. This regional one-off burger-known locally as the "Gargiulo"- hails from the historic roast-beef emporium Brennan & Carr. Here, the burger patty is topped with freshly sliced roast beef, sauteed onions, American cheese, and is eventually dunked in a vat of piping hot beef broth.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Steakhouse Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz usually smashes his patties with childlike glee. But today, he has his eyes set on a different prize: the luxurious, thick, dry-aged steakhouse burger! The beauty of this style is its lack of adornments-a juicy patty, cheese, and a sturdy bun, which all help emphasize the beef. In the words of Motz: "Take the upgrade people!" Without further ado, learn how to cook a perfect steakhouse burger at home!

programme.title: How to Cook a Loose Meat Sandwich with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Here's a weird one for you-the Loose Meat Sandwich from the Midwest. Is it a hamburger? We're not entirely sure. Is it amazing? Hell yes! Think of a Sloppy Joe, minus the slop. If you close your eyes and bite into a loose meat sandwich, you taste all the elements of a hamburger: bun, beef, seasoning, mustard, onion, pickle. And now it's George's job to bring this Midwest icon into your home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Mississippi Slugburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a hyper-regional slugburger from Northern Mississippi. Borne out of the Great Depression, the slugburger patty combines beef and bread crumbs-a method that was used to extend the meat supply. As the bread crumbs toast on the griddle, they absorb the rendered beef fat, creating the ultimate crispy burger. Here is your master class on how to make a regional slugburger at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Texas-Style Smoked Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz has taught us about fried burgers and steamed burgers, but did you know about the smoked burger from Texas? In this episode, George teaches you how to apply the principles of barbecue to a burger. With a simple offset smoker set-up, you can achieve the perfect smoke ring on this burger right in your own backyard. Here is your master class on the Texas smoked burger.

programme.title: How to Cook a Hawaiian Loco Moco Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is here to set the record straight: A real homegrown Hawaiian burger is NOT a beef patty topped with pineapple and ham. When locals crave a burger, they order something called the loco moco. Technically a 'burger plate,' this regional icon is a burger patty placed on a bed of rice, drenched in gravy, and topped with a fried egg. A popular late-night order at diners, the loco moco is one of George's favorite burgers to eat. And now's your chance to make one at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Deep-Fried Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In our season finale, Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a regional specialty from Tennessee: The deep-fried burger! At a place called Dyer's in Memphis, burgers are smashed paper thin and dipped in a skillet filled with hot beef tallow-a method that harkens back to the dawn of the original hamburger. Grease is an heirloom at Dyer's. When you bite into a burger from there, you're biting into history. That's because the same grease has been used since 1912!

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Patty Melt with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook his favorite patty melt! Motz says this is the burger he dreams about all the time, and you'll quickly learn why it's so unique. Borrowing a method from Wisconsin burger shacks, Motz poaches the hamburger patty in beef stock and slides it in between a grilled cheese. This is truly regional hamburger nirvana.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Double Cheeseburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook one of the most important hamburgers in America-the original double cheeseburger from Southern California's iconic Bob's Big Boy Restaurant. This is the double burger that birthed all other double burgers (and even predates the invention of the Big Mac by almost 30 years!). Learn how to make a perfect double cheeseburger at home while soaking up some hamburger history.

programme.title: How to Cook 2 Regional Fast-Food Burgers with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is taking you on a ride through regional American fast-food burger history! A lot of the big, commercial fast-food places have given the hamburger a bad wrap. Which is why George wants to set the record straight and show you two family-owned, hyper-regional burger chains that still do it right-Swensons in Ohio, and Fat Mo's in Tennessee. These beloved burgers are highly unique, and take a few twists and turns to get to the finished product.

programme.title: How to Cook a Spicy Malaysian Egg Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In this special episode of Burger Scholar Sessions, George Motz pulls back the curtain on an international street-food icon: the spicy Malaysian egg burger! This burger is so famous that it goes by several names-the Ramly Burger, the Sloppy Burger, and the "Sampah" Burger, which translates to "rubbish" in Malaysia. But this burger isn't rubbish at all it's a total flavor bomb. Wrapped in an egg and covered with spices, it's one of the craziest burgers George has ever tried.

programme.title: An Open Conversation about Kanye West
programme.desc: On this episode Complex staffers, Khal and Jinx, weigh in on Kanye's media takeover, from his interview with Charlamagne Tha God, his appearance on TMZ, and his current state of mind.

programme.title: Joji Judges a Boba Tea Battle Between Rich Brian and NIKI
programme.desc: Boba is one of the world's most beloved beverages. But what happens when NIKI and Rich Brian decide to trick out their drinks with some crazy toppings? After learning the bubble-tea basics from Boba Guys founder Bin Chen, NIKI and Brian go head-to-head in the boba battle of the century. Gummy bears? Check. Gushers? Check. Pop Rocks? Check! The only thing keeping NIKI and Brian from achieving bubble tea perfection is the limits of their own imaginations.

programme.title: Joji and Rich Brian Make International Burgers with Chef Ludo
programme.desc: Last year, chef Ludo Lefebvre taught Joji and Rich Brian how to make the perfect omelet. But can the boys finally impress their mentor by serving him a couple of tasty burgers? After learning the secrets behind Le Big Mec-Ludo's legendary French-twist on a double cheeseburger-Brian and Joji go head-to-head in an international burger battle for the ages. Which burger will Ludo choose: Brian's satay-and-sambal-slathered creation, or Joji's teriyaki-and-shrimp-topped monstrosity?

programme.title: Racks Most Expensive Supreme Purchase & Air Jordan 4 Levi's!
programme.desc: On this episode Tony sits down with Racks and answer some view questions. Racks shares his most expensive Supreme purchase and break down his thoughts on the Nike Zoom Fly Mercurial sneakers and the Air Jordan 4 Levi's in the black and white colorway.

programme.title: The Ultimate Regional Burger Road Trip with a Burger Scholar
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz and Alvin Cailan are going on the ultimate regional burger road trip-which includes a pit stop to eat America's original hamburger. Motz is a veteran road warrior: he's logged thousands of miles in his car chasing down burgers all over the country.

programme.title: South LA's African American Taco Movement
programme.desc: Miss Info meets a group of young, charismatic African-American entrepreneurs from Watts, South L.A, and Compton who are shaking up the taco scene, finding new meaning in L.A.'s iconic street food. Find out how upstarts like All Flavor No Grease and Taco Mell are making a name for themselves, and why rapper Casey Veggies says, "The food game turned into the rap game."

programme.title: Joji and Sean Evans Review Japanese Snacks
programme.desc: Joji is here to help Sean Evans navigate the often overwhelming world of the Japanese convenience store. Born and raised in Japan, the 88rising crooner takes our host on a snack-fueled journey through the Land of the Rising Sun.

programme.title: Filipino Food 101 With Jo Koy
programme.desc: When it came time for Sean Evans to dive head first into the menu at Jeepney Filipino Gastropub in NYC, the choice for a dinner companion was a no-brainer.

programme.title: Mike Chen and Claire Saffitz Explore Japanese Street Food and Candy
programme.desc: Japan Village is a 20,000-square-foot food hall in Brooklyn's Industry City, and Reina Scully is ready to explore every corner. But no food tour is complete without a few friends. Joining Reina on her adventure is Strictly Dumpling's Mike Chen, Bon Appétit's Claire Saffitz, and NYC restaurateur Sakura Yagi.

programme.title: Wagyu 101 with Sean Evans and Philip DeFranco
programme.desc: Japan is home to some of the world's most coveted cuts of meat. But what makes wagyu so expensive? From an $85 wagyu sando with Hot Ones host Sean Evans, to a $350 wagyu steak with her old boss Philip DeFranco, Reina Scully is eating her way through NYC's most decadent hunks of Japanese beef with a couple of friends. But what gives wagyu its famously marbled fat? And what's the deal with American wagyu popping up at restaurants?

programme.title: WWE Star Asuka Eats Japanese Eel
programme.desc: Eel is one of the most traditional ingredients in Japanese cooking. But in the U.S., the delicacy is still largely misunderstood. On this episode of Gochi Gang, Reina Scully is embarking on an eel-eating adventure. First, Chef Hiroki Fukushima gives Reina a crash course in the preparation of unagi, or freshwater eel, at Unagi Aburi Ittetsu. And later, Reina teams up with WWE superstar and sushi obsessive Asuka for an omakase experience centered around anago, unagi's saltwater cousin.

programme.title: Meek Mill & Lil Baby Albums, Jay Explains 'What's Free' Line, Em's 'Kick Off'
programme.desc: Nadeska, Wayno and DJ Akademiks review the latest projects released by Meek Mill and Lil Baby. After dropping 'Wins & Loses' in 2017, Meek returned last week with the release of his fourth studio album, 'Championships.' The new LP, which features a star-studded line-up of guest appearances, is highlighted by the Jay-Z and Rick Ross-assisted track, "What's Free," as well as the Drake and Meek collab joint "Going Bad.

programme.title: Kanye Still Obsessing About Drake, Bobby Shmurda Dropping a Tape From Prison?
programme.desc: On Tuesday's (Jan. 28) episode of #EverydayStruggle, Nadeska, Wayno and DJ Akademiks continue to mourn the loss of legendary basketball player Kobe Bryant, and his 13-year-old daughter Gianna Bryant. The crew shares the latest updates of the helicopter accident investigation, and also speak on 50 Cent announcing that Kobe's death has made him a changed man.

programme.title: Blueface Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Blueface goes Sneaker Shopping at Flight Club in Los Angeles and talks about playing football in high school, his love of blue sneakers, and how he used to do meet and greets in Foot Lockers.

programme.title: Will Smith And Martin Lawrence Go Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Will Smith and Martin Lawrence go Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in NYC, and talk about setting trends on their sitcoms, getting their own sneaker collabs and footwear choices in "Bad Boys For Life."

programme.title: Matty Matheson and Sean Evans Have a Poutine Showdown
programme.desc: Poutine is a Montreal staple-a glorious combination of fries, cheese curds, and gravy that ranks as one of the world's great hangover cures.

programme.title: Jimmy Fallon Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Complex's Joe La Puma goes Sneaker Shopping with the host of the Tonight Show, Jimmy Fallon, at Flight Club in New York City to talk about his history in sneakers, getting dissed by Barneys' employees back in the day, and Hasan Minhaj hooking him up with Air Jordan 1s.

programme.title: Queens & Cowboys
programme.desc: Roping and riding across North America, the International Gay Rodeo Association's courageous cowboys and cowgirls brave challenges both in and out of the arena on their quest to qualify for the World Finals. Along the way, they'll bust every stereotype in the book. The film tells the story of five members of the IGRA. From Wade Earp, a descendant of cowboy legend Wyatt Earp and one of the best competitors on the circuit, to Char Duran, a female bull rider who's never won a buckle but seems determined to die trying, "QUEENS & COWBOYS" weaves the stories of its protagonists over the course of an entire rabble-rousing year. An unprecedented look at the strength it takes to be gay in the rural west, this film explores the many struggles threatening the IGRA and the gay community at large, how far society has come on the subject of gay equality, and how far we still have to go.

programme.title: Jobriath A.D.
programme.desc: Known as the first openly gay rock star, Jobriath's reign was a brief two years. Done in by over-hyped publicity, shunned by the gay community, and dismissed by critics, Jobriath retreated to the Chelsea Hotel, where he died forgotten, one of the earliest casualties of AIDS. But years later, new fans discover his music, and acts such as The Pet Shop Boys, Def Leppard, and Morrissey cite him as an influence. Experience the heartbreaking, unbelievable story of the one, the only, Jobriath.

programme.title: The QueerX Awards
programme.desc: The circus is in town and just in time for National Coming Out Day! Welcome to the 2021 QueerX Awards brought to you by Lexus. Join us as hosts, Drew Droege and Raneir Pollard, take us on a carnival tour of LGBTQ music, films, and icons! Featuring appearances by Bowen Yang, Michaela Jaé Rodriguez, Patton Oswalt, Dwyane Wade, Erica Wheeler, and Elvira, Mistress of the Dark, Cassandra Peterson. And don't miss the special performances by Chanel and the Circus, Mila Jam, and Alsace Carcione.

programme.title: The Walk-In Closet
programme.desc: S1 E1-4 | Dana delivers a big package. Sterling receives some very, very scary news./Sterling is very, very sad and drunk Billie does a Drew Barrymore impression. They come up with a plan!/ It's Billie's straight brother Dom's birthday!/It's time for the first real test! Billie and Sterling meet Ms. Hutchcroft, the immigration official.

programme.title: The Walk-In Closet
programme.desc: S1 E5-8 | Billie goes to "work" at the "comedy" club./Sterling and Billie keep up the super, super good work of passing as straight at the local gym. Dana makes another delivery./Ms. Hutchcroft makes a home visit./Billie and Sterling come to a tough realization.

programme.title: A Very Sordid Wedding
programme.desc: Seventeen years after family matriarch Peggy tripped over G.W.'s wooden legs in Sordid Lives, same-sex marriage equality has barreled into Winters, Texas and not everyone is ready to accept it. An anniversary memorial service is being planned in honor of Peggy at the bar while the Southside Baptist Church plans an "Anti-Equality" rally to protest the abomination of gay marriage and work to defend their religious freedom. The beloved cast of colorful characters are all on a collision course for shenanigans and fireworks on the big night. Along the way a bisexual serial killer shows up, a drag queen country medley is performed and a beauty-salon-versus-the-bigots battle turns getting your hair done into the front lines of the equality battle. Friendships are tested and families are reunited as fear and bigotry are confronted with acceptance and understanding on the way to a surprise wedding with (almost) everyone in attendance.

programme.title: Braking For Whales

With no choice or face losing their much-needed inheritance - they embark on a road trip to San Antonio, Texas where they not only encounter adventure, but also encounter each other. Braking For Whales stars Tom Felton, Tammin Sursok, Wendi Mclendon-Covey, David Koechner, and Austin Swift.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone. As always, they start with twenty competitors, but only twelve of them pass to the second round.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants – male and female, young and old, fit and not-so-fit – take on four grueling, but wildly funny obstacles to win the title of the fourth Wipeout Champion and the grand cash prize.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This episode welcomes a set of contestants to Buenos Aires to take on the wrath of some seriously hard obstacles in the hope of bagging 10,000 pounds and a rather cool trophy. The Qualifier sees the return of an old favourite, the Big Red Balls, and the Motivator to provide a little help for those feeling reluctant to throw themselves off the ledge.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Contestants face different games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone. The Qualifier is comprised of some fiendish hurdles to cross, including the famous Big Red Balls and the Sucker Punch - both poised to send the contestants flying into pools of water and mud. Crash Mountain and Dizzy Dummies cut the line-up down even more before the final challenge awaits.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'International Special' and Richard Hammond, your giggling, non-partisan hosts as British brilliance on the world's craziest obstacle course is put to the test by the finest athletes from Germany, France, and the USA, amongst others. The game is divided into two teams, one with UK contestants, and the other with people from all over the world.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the last episode of the season and the eight previous winners compete to be crowned Champion of Champions. Will one of the already crowned champions walk away with the trophy and prize money, or will one of the runners-up get their revenge? It's a thrilling ride to find out!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Some people believe that the Oscars mark the highlight of the awards season, while others would argue the Baftas are the most exciting event of the year. However, most would agree that Total Wipeout - The Awards provides the biggest laughs. This programme presented by Richard Hammond encompasses all of the best action of the series.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Crashes, smashes and hilarious mud splashes are on the cards as ten celebrities from the world of sport, music and television take on one of the largest and most extreme obstacle courses in the world. They journey across the globe to the purpose-built Total Wipeout course in Argentina to put their strength, balance and bravery to the test in the hope of winning 10,000 pounds for charity.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E12 "Breaking Down the Hunt, Josh’s Best Lesson"
programme.desc: On this week's episode we start off by joining multiple members of the team as they fill their turkey tags. Then we join Bill, who breaks down the hunt for the massive buck he harvested back in 2016 that he called "Lefty." Next we join Josh Sparks who discusses the best lesson he's learned over his last 4 years of hunting.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E13 "Big Bucks on Permission, Poor Man Plot Success"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we start off with Bill who shows how successful one of the Poor Man Plots he put in last season is doing. He covers the steps he took to make the plot and offers tips so you can make one of your own. Then we join Josh Sparks who lays out the plans for a food plot that he and Kaleb Greiner are creating using this poor man style. Finally, we join Jared Mills on a throwback hunt as he covers some of the biggest challenges that come with hunting big deer on permission. Jared also offers creative advice on how to gain permission for hunting.

programme.title: "On Deck" With Captain Cory McGuire
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late." Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Elegant Dinner Party
programme.desc: In this episode, Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to the ultimate Braised Brisket with Pomegranate, Cumin, and Cilantro. In the Equipment Corner, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews his top pick for twist corkscrews. Finally, test cook Dan Souza makes a decadent Duchess Potato Casserole.

programme.title: Roast Chicken and Sprouts
programme.desc: In this episode, Julia and Bridget unlock the secrets to the ultimate Roast Chicken with Warm Bread Salad. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of white miso. Finally, test cook Elle Simone teaches Bridget how to make foolproof Skillet-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Chile, Peanuts, and Mint.

programme.title: Ham Dinner
programme.desc: Ham dinner-with green bean casserole-is classic American fare. But which kind of ham should you buy? And can you really make a "good" green bean casserole? We show you how.

programme.title: Fried Rice and Kung Pao Shrimp
programme.desc: We show you how to prepare fried rice and kung pao shrimp. Our findings about rice cookers and long-grain white rice guarantee perfect rice every time.

programme.title: Salad 101
programme.desc: Many Greek salads are no more than iceberg lettuce topped with an overly acidic dressing and a few crumbs of feta cheese. And spinach salad is also often drowned in an oily, bland dressing and sprinkled with minuscule bacon bits. We set out to create flavorful, fresh-tasting versions of these two salads.

programme.title: Tea Time
programme.desc: In the test kitchen, we think afternoon (or morning) tea is an excellent excuse to whip up a batch of scones or a golden loaf of lemon pound cake. Making these baked goods at home certainly yields better results than what you can buy. We'll show you how.

programme.title: Family Favorites
programme.desc: In this episode, we offer delicious, relatively straightforward fare that appeals to young and old. What kid-or adult-doesn't look forward to macaroni and cheese or barbecued chicken?

programme.title: Bake Sale Favorites
programme.desc: Brownies are too often dull, and blondies (as well as congo bars, their coconut-flavored cousins) can be even worse, since they are even plainer. When we created recipes for these favorite bake sale items, we kept things simple while focusing on developing superior flavor and texture.

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: In this episode we look at a few of our favorite Tex-Mex dishes: tomato salsa, quesadillas, and beef tacos.

programme.title: Indian and Thai Curries
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare an Indian-inspired shrimp curry and a Thai-inspired green curry with chicken.

programme.title: Two Ways with Pork
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, perhaps due to the fact that this cut is often more familiar at a restaurant table than the home kitchen. But that doesn't mean you need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: Rainy Day Barbecue
programme.desc: If the weather is too poor for grilling and a hankering for ribs strikes, is the only choice a trip to a local barbecue joint? Or could we find the answer in the home kitchen?

programme.title: Fish Tacos and Steak Fajitas
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof and host Bridget Lancaster prepare a Southern California classic, Smoked Fish Tacos. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick of chimney starters. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison makes Julia Grilled Steak Fajitas.

programme.title: The Perfect Cake
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison and host Julia Collin Davison reveal the steps to making a showstopping Blueberry Jam Cake. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews toasters with host Bridget Lancaster.

programme.title: BBQ Thighs and Fried Peach Pies
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison unveils the secrets to the ultimate Barbecue Chicken Thighs to host, Bridget Lancaster. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of popcorn. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof demonstrates how to make Fried Peach Pies at home.

programme.title: Pork Tacos and Churros
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison prepares showstopping Citrus-Braised Pork Tacos. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a mild salsa taste test. Next, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make unforgettable So-Cal-inspired Churros. And finally, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his favorite piping set.

programme.title: Spaghetti House Classics
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Julia Collin Davison the perfect Hearty Beef Lasagna. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of block mozzarella. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Bridget a new weeknight favorite-Chicken Scarpariello.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - A Beautiful Plate of Pasta / Un Bellissimo Piatto di Pasta
programme.desc: Krazy for Kale? Mary Ann is, when she creates Farfalle with Kale Sauce as colorful to look at as it is wonderful to taste. Then it’s time to get creative with farro flour and make a potful of fettucine-cut pasta to toss with creamy sauce of burrata cheese, spring onions, fresh marjoram, and finely chopped and toasted walnuts.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Mr. Fish Head
programme.desc: Martin visits Damenlou or “Big Door” restaurant, the haunt of Singapore’s legendary and beloved character, Mr. Fish Head. This episode's recipes include: Singapore’s Fish Head Soup and Family-Style Fish with Bean Sprouts.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Out Of Africa
programme.desc: The focus is on Africa where live fire cooking began. Recipes include: Piri Piri Wings, Cape Malay Sosaties and Kenyan Lamb.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Late Night Dining
programme.desc: We take you along to the biggest charity event in the Napa Valley and then come back home to make some late-night favorites: a home-style onion soup, a spicy spaghetti Amatriciana, and dried-fruit compote flavored with Sambuca.

programme.title: Lidias Italian Table - Gnocchi
programme.desc: Gnocchi is a Lidia favorite. As a child, it was a Sunday dinner staple on the Matticchio table, which Lidia helped her mother cook. The secret to great gnocchi is making it light and fluffy, then shaping it. Lidia makes two gnocchi dishes: gnocchi in Lidia’s plain tomato sauce and gnocchi rolled and filled with ricotta/spinach/leek stuffing, dressed with a savory sage butter sauce.

programme.title: Infusion - Vegan
programme.desc: Veganism is both the practice of abstaining from the use of animal products particularly in diet and an associated philosophy that rejects the commodity status of animals. The term vegan was coined in 1944 by Donald Watson when he co-founded the Vegan Society in England. At first this meant non-dairy vegetarian and later the doctrine that man should live without exploiting animals.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Potatoes
programme.desc: One Potato, two potato, oh, so many potatoes. Julia and Jacques share their tricks, “trucs” and techniques for perfect baked potatoes, airy mashed potatoes, creamy potato casserole, and delightful lighter-than-air crispy-fried pommes soufflés.

programme.title: Cucina Amore - North African Mussels and Clams
programme.desc: Spicy, fragrant mussels and clams in tomato-infused sauce couscous spinach pilaf with the fresh touch of lemon and creamy mascarpone coffee whip with chocolate sauce.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table - Born in The Kitchen
programme.desc: This series brings authentic Mexican flavors, colors, textures and warmth into American kitchens. A former policy analyst focused on Latin American politics and history, Pati Jinich is also a chef, cooking teacher, food writer and mother of 3 whose true passion lies in sharing the tastes of her childhood and culinary adventures in her native country.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - Mother Knows Best
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia cooks with Gary Danko who also learned about food from his mom. In the kitchens of Restaurant Gary Danko, where reservations are coveted like winning lottery tickets, Cecilia and Gary recreate the Mandarin’s crispy Szechuan duck and then Gary shows Cecilia his lemon pepper duck breast with confit duck hash.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - Bacon or Pancetta
programme.desc: Chef Stellino attempts to answer the age old question - which is better - bacon or pancetta? Dishes include: Ragu' Di Gamberetti/ Shrimp Amatriciana with Pasta / Insalata Del Sogno / Watermelon Salad with Tomato and Bacon.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - A Beautiful Plate of Pasta / Un Bellissimo Piatto di Pasta
programme.desc: Krazy for Kale? Mary Ann is, when she creates Farfalle with Kale Sauce as colorful to look at as it is wonderful to taste. Then it’s time to get creative with farro flour and make a potful of fettucine-cut pasta to toss with creamy sauce of burrata cheese, spring onions, fresh marjoram, and finely chopped and toasted walnuts.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Mr. Fish Head
programme.desc: Martin visits Damenlou or “Big Door” restaurant, the haunt of Singapore’s legendary and beloved character, Mr. Fish Head. This episode's recipes include: Singapore’s Fish Head Soup and Family-Style Fish with Bean Sprouts.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Out Of Africa
programme.desc: The focus is on Africa where live fire cooking began. Recipes include: Piri Piri Wings, Cape Malay Sosaties and Kenyan Lamb.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Late Night Dining
programme.desc: We take you along to the biggest charity event in the Napa Valley and then come back home to make some late-night favorites: a home-style onion soup, a spicy spaghetti Amatriciana, and dried-fruit compote flavored with Sambuca.

programme.title: Lidias Italian Table - Gnocchi
programme.desc: Gnocchi is a Lidia favorite. As a child, it was a Sunday dinner staple on the Matticchio table, which Lidia helped her mother cook. The secret to great gnocchi is making it light and fluffy, then shaping it. Lidia makes two gnocchi dishes: gnocchi in Lidia’s plain tomato sauce and gnocchi rolled and filled with ricotta/spinach/leek stuffing, dressed with a savory sage butter sauce.

programme.title: Infusion - Vegan
programme.desc: Veganism is both the practice of abstaining from the use of animal products particularly in diet and an associated philosophy that rejects the commodity status of animals. The term vegan was coined in 1944 by Donald Watson when he co-founded the Vegan Society in England. At first this meant non-dairy vegetarian and later the doctrine that man should live without exploiting animals.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Potatoes
programme.desc: One Potato, two potato, oh, so many potatoes. Julia and Jacques share their tricks, “trucs” and techniques for perfect baked potatoes, airy mashed potatoes, creamy potato casserole, and delightful lighter-than-air crispy-fried pommes soufflés.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Shikoku
programme.desc: Henry's adventure in Shikoku begins at Botchan Train. He attempts cormorant fishing during the day and visits the Dogo onsen at night to relax and unwind. The next day, he experiences the Awa-odori folk dance which is usually performed to welcome the souls of ancestors in the Bon season. Then he samples a local Tosa Tataki Dojo and travels out on boat for some spectacular whale watching.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Kyushu
programme.desc: In Kyushu, Henry visits the Kumamoto Castle which offers one of the most complete castle experiences in Japan with a Japanese local. They also discover the history behind one of Japan's most famous swordsman and ronin, Miyamoto Mushashi. Later, Henry learns more about Yanagawa punting and the antique Japanese Arita porcelain. At the Nagasaki Penguin Aquarium, they experience penguins not just by making eye contact, but by actually interacting with the wonderful creatures. They also attempt a traditional dry beach fishing method from the Edo Period by catching the unique gobble-eyed Gobi. Wrapping up their journey in Kyushu, they experience garden light illumination at a European resort themed on Holland, Haus Ten Bosch.

programme.title: Welcome to the Railworld Japan - Okinawa
programme.desc: In his final adventure in Japan, Henry experiences traveling on monorail to Okinawa where he kicks off with a visit to the Churaumi Aquarium with a Japanese local. Since Okinawa is also known for its Tsuboya pottery, they decide to explore the Yomitan Pottery Village. With plans to fulfill Henry's lack of martial arts training, they challenge themselves to a karate training session at the place where this art was birthed. At the old folk houses of Ryukyu-mura, they experience the simple sounds of the shamisen and the locals' traditional ways of life. After admiring the limestone caves at Gyokusen Cave, they drop by Shuri Castle to discover more about the Ryukyu Kingdom. And finally, Henry wraps up his entire Japan adventure diving in the near-perfect waters of Zamami and Gahi Island.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Footings and Foundations
programme.desc: Kevin discusses This Old House's history renovating Colonials and Colonial Revivals. The Lexington homeowners want to stay in their house during the renovation, so Tom shows Kevin how he's going to demo in phases, keeping the kitchen intact for as long as possible. Today, they'll do exterior demo only, starting with the back porch. Kevin visits a concrete shop in Amesbury, Massachusetts, to see them make the prefabricated concrete footings needed for our job. Norm explains the framing of the first floor platform from underneath, then climbs up on top to see how Tom is building the rear gable wall of the addition lying down: they sheath it, add the cellular PVC rake boards, and then stand the wall up. Roger gets underway with the layout and excavation for the new footings for the first floor addition. The new prefab footings are unloaded into the backyard, set, leveled and plumbed. Tom leaves them exposed so the inspector can sign off before back filling. Kevin explains the building permit process and the role of the building commissioner, Fred Lonardo, as he comes in to make his first inspection on the footings.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Curb Appeal
programme.desc: At the Lexington project, Kevin finds the front gable wall of the second floor up, and the roof framing underway. Around back, Tom installs a 24-foot long LVL to temporarily hold up the second floor while he adds new structure. Then, they frame the rest of the addition roof. Nearby in Lexington's historic district, architect Frank Shirley shows Norm how people have been using front porches to lend character and charm to Colonial style homes for hundreds of years. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin the framing of our new farmer's porch and then they build a small overhang to extend the look across the garage. Inside, Kevin sees how the homeowners are getting by without a kitchen, which has been gutted and is ready to be expanded thanks to a 24-foot steel beam that will carry the weight of the second floor. Later, Tom presents a solution to the ceiling height challenge in the old part of the kitchen: a structural ceiling that will allow him to gain some height over the islands, while allowing for both adequate structure, and a clever chase for wiring.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Smart Solutions
programme.desc: Norm visits the Hancock-Clarke house to see where Paul Revere stopped to warn John Hancock and Samuel Adams of the advancing British troops during the start of the American Revolution. Kevin recaps how the roofers applied new architectural shingles to tie the old house in with the new addition. Tom shows Kevin the progress on the new back deck, and how the architect has called for a corner stair leading down to the backyard. The framing requires two sets of traditional stringer systems, joined in the middle by a hip stringer and a series of jack stringers the same idea as framing a hip roof. Kevin finds Richard and plumbing contractor Kevin Bilo fighting to keep the P-trap from the new bathtub on the second floor from interfering with the decorative ceiling of the new kitchen. They use a new German bath waste and overflow kit that allows for the flexibility needed to solve the problem. Kevin and Norm finish up the trim and decking on the new corner deck stair. For the ipe deckboards that are sharply mitered in the corner, Norm has settled on using a floating tenon connection to prevent them from opening up over time

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Making Connections
programme.desc: Roger meets landscape designer Tim Lee to see how the small stream in the backyard affects all other areas of the yard, including a patch of grass that has to be returned to the wild, and a stand of trees out front that can now be removed after careful consideration by the Conservation Commission. Before the trees come down, Roger shows Kevin the valuable shade plants that could be damaged in the process, so they're relocated to a new bed in the side yard to provide screening from the neighboring house. Tom and Kevin cut away a five-foot section of wall to connect the new kitchen to the old great room. Richard shows Kevin two common rough plumbing conditions in the kitchen: a main sink that has a traditional drain and vent configuration, and an island prep sink, which requires a bow vent in order to work properly. Kevin meets building inspector Fred Lonardo to learn how a GC can call for a "partial framing inspection" to keep progress moving on a job, as in the case with our front porch. Arborist John Marquis shows Roger the proper preparation, safety precautions, and procedures for doing a "take down" of the 12 trees in the front yard.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Exterior Details
programme.desc: Tom shows Kevin the new mudroom door and the work required to patch in new clapboards to match the old around it. Inside, two weeks of rough electrical is coming to a close as the subs call for their inspection. Kevin meets electrician Allen Gallant and inspector Alix Berube to see what goes into a rough electrical inspection. At the back deck, Tom shows Kevin how he's using a hybrid railing system that has cedar posts and railing caps, with stainless steel cable "balusters". Kevin visits kitchen designer Donna Venegas at her showroom at Boston's Design Center to see the neutrals, textures, and metallics that are currently trending in kitchens. Then, project designer Michele Kelly and homeowner Jeremy Kieval show Kevin the layout and design choices for the new family kitchen. With a house from 1966, almost anything goes, so paint color expert Bonnie Krims gives Kevin and homeowner Jody Kieval a range of options for the exterior colors

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Inspections
programme.desc: Norm and Tom install reinforced fiberglass columns to support the new farmer's porch. Richard meets plumbing contractor Brian Bilo and local plumbing inspector Donald "Duke" LaConte to see what he's looking for at our rough plumbing inspection. Kevin and Tom meet building commissioner Fred Lonardo to see what goes into the rough mechanical and rough framing inspections. After Fred signs off, insulation begins. Tom shows Kevin the storm window system he's using to enclose the screen porch, and Russell Parrot shows how we're going to heat the space: with electric radiant floor heat. Norm and Tom welcome back Fred Lonardo to review the various ways we can achieve the insulation value we need in our walls to meet code.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Conservation Concerns
programme.desc: Kevin drives up to find gutter fabricator Mike Vidulich installing a one-piece covered gutter that should never have to be cleaned. In the backyard, Roger shows Kevin the native plants he's using to turn a patch of lawn back to nature, as required by the local Conservation Commission. Master electrician Allen Gallant shows Kevin the existing aluminum wiring in the old part of the house and how he's safely working with it to update the recessed light fixtures and add new sconces over the mantel. Norm visits a factory in Londonderry, NH to see how they're making and testing two types of windows for our project. Roger shows Kevin the last piece of the Conservation puzzle, the infiltration system that is going to disperse the water from our gutters into the ground

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Old to New
programme.desc: Norm arrives and recaps progress on mudroom and kitchen, and finds tile contractor Mark Ferrante installing a porcelain plank floor tile that is made to look like wood. He's using it on both the treads and risers of the stairs to the garage. Master electrician Allen Gallant shows Kevin how to properly abandon an old electrical box, and how to fish wires to a new one. Then, in the adjacent great room, Kevin shows how to patch in the huge holes where the old recessed lights were: rigid insulation, strapping, wallboard and plaster. In the backyard, painting contractor Mauro Henrique shows Norm a smart and efficient way to paint shutters. With a blank slate in the basement, Richard shows Kevin the thinking that goes into the logical layout of a mechanical room.ŒåäóæTom shows Kevin how he's turning an arched doorway into one that's squared off to match the rest of the openings on the first floor.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Designer Details
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find the second floor sanded, stained and sealed, and finds Tom overseeing the crew as they start on the first floor, turning the bleached out red oak floors to a dark walnut color. In the kitchen, the cabinets are mostly installed, and carpenter Chuck Parker shows Norm the custom refrigerator panels and how he's properly mounting them to the refrigerator. In Lexington Center, just steps from the Battle Green, Kevin meets local designer Robin Gannon to see how she used her modern and eclectic style to decorate 22 rooms of a historic inn. In the temporary garage workshop, Norm shows Kevin how he's turning a chest of drawers into a sink base for the new powder room.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | New Walk, Old Stone
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Roger starting on the new bluestone front walk despite some significant grade challenges. Around back, Norm finds tile contractor Mark Ferrante installing porcelain tile made to look like slate in the screen porch. Kevin recaps the vanity project and meets Richard to see the sink and faucet set. Nearby in Acton, MA, Roger visits a stone salvage yard to see how Gavin Johnston is selecting and fabricating antique granite for the front walk and custom house marker. At the end of the day, Kevin sees the granite steps in place and lends a hand as Roger sets the house marker

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Mudroom, Ventilation, Kids' Rooms
programme.desc: Master electrician Allen Gallant shows Kevin the new LED ribbon strip lights he's using under the cabinets in the kitchen and butler's pantry. Norm and Tom build the new mudroom storage system, focusing on the darkly stained maple top and the rail and stile doors and panels. Richard and Tom review the critical need for ventilation in our modern, super insulated buildings. Wallpaper hanger Mark Pehrson shows Kevin his technique for applying wallpaper to a ceiling in one of the girl's rooms. In another daughter's bedroom, Kevin finds painting contractor Mauro Henrique setting up to paint decorative stripes on an accent wall.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Finishing Details
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Roger and landscape designer Tim Lee placing the first new plants in the planting plan. The rest will be installed over time by the homeowners. Richard shows Kevin how he's using two kinds of radiators to bring heat to the garage, and the upstairs sitting room. Installer Bob Young shows Norm the new insulated steel garage doors that should help keep the heat inside the garage. Tom shows Kevin the progress on the upstairs laundry room that is outfitted with simple cabinets and a small countertop. In the great room, master electrician Allen Gallant shows Kevin how he's installing a massive wrought-iron chandelier with 52 bulbs.

programme.desc: Patti takes on Justin, the "Human Ken Doll" and Claudia, a 3x divorcee who cliff dives into toxic relationships. As painful pasts are revealed, can Patti break their bad dating habits and find them love?

programme.title: Million Dollar Matchmaker: The Princess and the Man Boy
programme.desc: A former Princess must learn to leave behind the baggage of her royal past to look toward a future. A comedian uses his jokes to deflect intimacy. Patti gets ambushed. Ex-employees Destin and Rachel are back!

programme.title: Million Dollar Matchmaker: Farrah Abraham and the Obsessed Dad
programme.desc: Teen Mom's Farrah Abraham, a reality star infamous for being in the adult industry, and an overprotective father who needs his sexy back, seek Patti's help to find love.

programme.title: Million Dollar Matchmaker: Loosey Goosey and Mr. Forever 21
programme.desc: Patti takes on Anna Lisa, a party girl who needs to curb her playgirl ways and get serious about love. And Tony, Patti's friend who dates too young needs an intervention or he could end up alone forever.

programme.title: Million Dollar Matchmaker: The Pop Star and American Psycho
programme.desc: Patti takes on a high-powered perfectionist who can't find his "perfect" match and an overtly sexual singer who leads with her body, and not her heart. Both clients check out with someone they never expected...

programme.title: Million Dollar Matchmaker: The Dumped DJ and Shallow Hal
programme.desc: Derek, a fashion designer who is too shallow to settle, and Traci, a DJ who harbors major trust issues, seek Patti's help for love. One client begs for a second chance when their contract gets revoked!

programme.title: Million Dollar Matchmaker: The Ice Queen and the Playboy Chef
programme.desc: Drama erupts when Patti tries to thaw an Ice Queen's frozen heart. Chef Roble, who must whip up a balance between love and work, checks in. All hell breaks loose when one client tests Patti's patience.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Ten (Part Two) " - In the season finale, tempers flare as the two contestants prepare one last dinner service for Chef Ramsay.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 15 Chefs Compete" - Chef Gordon Ramsay returns for a fourth season of culinary torture. Fifteen chefs will compete for the chance to work at Ramsay's own restaurant in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 14 Chefs Compete" - The season's first challenge finds the contestants slicing halibut into thin six-ounce fillets. One member of each team must serve as maître d' during the dining service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 13 Chefs Compete" - After chickens wake them up in their living quarters, the contestants must pluck what once clucked, then cook them for the evening's family-style dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 12 Chefs Compete" - The two teams compete to make the most pasta for the evening's dinner service, and a kitchen accident puts one contestant in the hospital.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 11 Chefs Compete" - The first challenge for the remaining eleven chefs: make a gourmet pizza. The winners enjoy gourmet burgers in Santa Barbara while the losers prepare for the night's dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 10 Chefs Compete" - The ten remaining chefs must please a picky teen who has come to Hell's Kitchen for her birthday party. The team that designs the best menu wins a teen-themed treat.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 9 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay makes the nine remaining chefs take a blindfolded taste test. The winners get to go to a spa the losers must clean the dorm.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 8 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay asks for a volunteer to switch sides. The group dynamic changes as the teams face their next challenge: creating four dishes using twenty specific ingredients.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 7 Chefs Compete" - In the opening challenge, the two teams compete in a relay race. The winners earn surfing lessons while the losers must clean Hell's Kitchen from top to bottom.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited #2
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay revisits restaurants Giuseppi and Sante La Brea, from season two, to see if they have succeeded there is good news and there is bad news. Also included is an update on what happened at Finn McCool's.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Spanish Pavillion
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey. He discovers that a pair of bickering brothers are running the eatery to the ground with their undercooked food and outdated atmosphere.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Classic American
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay arrives at debt-ridden eatery owned by two former waitresses. Things are so bad that Ramsay holds an intervention to address leadership and communication problems.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: PJ's Steakhouse
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse, a restaurant that is dying due to management's lack of control and poor food quality.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited No. 4
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to a few restaurants to see if they took his advice. The eateries he visits include Mojito, The Junction (formerly Flamango's) and Bazzini.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Grasshopper Also
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay makes the trek to Carlstadt, New Jersey to visit Grasshopper Also, an eatery that has seen better days.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Davide
programme.desc: Traveling to Boston's North End, Chef Ramsay spends a week at Davide, an Italian eatery mismanaged by feuding brothers.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: DownCity
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Providence, Rhode Island to visit DownCity, a downtrodden eatery held back by a stubborn, short-tempered owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited No. 5
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to Lido di Manhattan, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro to see if the owners have implemented his changes.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Cafe Tavolini
programme.desc: While in Bridgeport, Connecticut, Chef Ramsay pays Cafe Tavolini a visit. Two lackadaisical owners watch as their eatery goes south.
